commitResults.messageBody: Modified the naming convention and reduced the use of global variables to fit the coding standard.

Lemon.java: add error checking and exception
handling for todo, deadline and event tasks,
and for marking and unmarking of tasks

LemonException.java: add a class to represent
exceptions specific to Lemon

Error handling is not implemented in Lemon.java.

Wrong input from users may cause error and
exceptions causing the program to fail or exit.

Implement error and exception handling.

Implementing error handling allows the program to
respond to unexpected input gracefully. Users are
also able to know how to pass a valid input.

Error and exceptions include wrong format input,
invalid input, empty input, array index out of
bounds, null pointer, empty list, unexpected input.

Create 2 packages: lemon.command and lemon.task

LemonException.java move to lemon.command
Task.java, Todo.java, Deadline.java, Event.java
move to lemon.task

Modified Lemon.java to fit the coding quality and
standards. Shortened markTask() method by adding
a checkEmptyList() method. Explicitly listed
imported classes and renamed variables.

Added the delete function in Lemon.java to
allow deletion of tasks. Exception handling was
done for this delete function.

Updated the printAddedTask method to
printAddedOrDeletedTask method to print the
status of the list for both add and delete
functions.

Updated the checkEmptyList method to send
customized exception message for the delete
function in the case of an empty list.

Changed the fixed array used to store tasks to
a resizable ArrayList. This provides dynamic
sizing and improved flexibility. Updated
various methods to replace array indexing,
retrieving, adding and deleting of objects with
ArrayList methods.

Data will be loaded from a file in hard disk
during bootup. Tasks can now be saved in the
hard disk whenever changes are made to the
tasks. Changes include adding, deleting,
marking and unmarking of tasks. Exception and
error handling is implemented.

Resolved conflicts.
Fixed code for the functions to work properly.

Created new classes Command.java, Messages.java,
Storage.java, TaskList.java, UI.java, Parser.java.

Extracted closely related functions as classes.

Command.java and *Command.java classes executes
the various commands from user.

Messages.java stores all the constant messages to
be displayed to the user.

Storage.java manages the loading and saving of
data to and from a text file.

TaskList.java manages the task list, it performs
functions like adding, deleting, marking, and
unmarking of tasks. Tasks in the task list and
size of the task list can also be retrieved here.
It can also check if the list is empty.

UI.java handles the receiving and displaying of
messages to and from the user.

Parser.java checks if the user input is valid and
of the right format before proceeding with the
execution of commands.

Added the find function for users to find tasks by
the keyword given by them.

FindCommand.java was added to execute the find
function.

ListCommand.java, Messages.java, Task.java,
TaskList.java, UI.java, Parser.java were modified
to support the find function.

The displayTaskList and displayFoundList methods
were differentiated.
Added JavaDoc comments to all classes of the code.
Added a User Guide in README.md
